DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , open-label , multi-center , non-comparative study conduct female subject 30 75 year age , diagnose stress urinary incontinence ( SUI ) . Following screening period , include urodynamic assessment confirm SUI , subject undergo three FemiLiftTM treatment session , follow period one year . The main efficacy endpoint study define significant improvement ( score 6 7 ) urinary incontinence measure PGI-I score 6 month visit . Various subjective objective measure incontinence severity , quality life , sexual function tissue effect perform follow .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Carbone Dioxide ( CO2 ) Laser System Treatment Female Stress Urinary Incontinence .
DOC.detailed_description: Improvement SUI symptom measure follow parameter : Objective parameter : - Change baseline 3 day Urinary Diary - 1 , 2 , 6 12 month : - Number incontinence episode per day - Number pad use per day - Change baseline 1 hour pad test 1 , 2 , 6 12 month - Change baseline assess Vaginal Biopsy Subjective parameter : - Patient Global Impression Severity ( PGI-S ) - 4-point Likert scale - screening , 1 , 2 , 6 12 month - Change baseline Pelvic Floor Distress Inventory Questionnaire ( PFDI ) - 1 , 2 , 6 12 month - Change baseline Pelvic Organ Prolapse/Urinary Incontinence Sexual Questionnaire ( PISQ ) - 1 , 2 , 6 12 month - Change baseline Pelvic Floor Impact Questionnaire ( PFIQ ) - 1 , 2 , 6 12 month
DOC.criteria: Females 30 75 year age Provided write Informed Consent Patients mild moderate stress urinary incontinence ( SUI ) [ accord severity index develop Sandvik ] Patients mixed urinary incontinence , predominant symptom stress relate , may also enrol Normal Papanicolaou smear ( 1 year prior screen ) Negative urine culture Vaginal canal , introitus vestibule free injury bleed Positive urinary stress test ( Urine leakage demonstrate patient examine full bladder lithotomy position , ask perform 3 strong cough ) . Positive pregnancy test Planned pregnancy within next year Severe prolapse ( POP > = grade 3 ) Use photosensitive drug Injury or/and active infection treatment area Active vaginal infection human papillomavirus/herpes simplex virus Undiagnosed vaginal bleeding Urge overflow incontinence Patients antidepressant , Î±adrenergic anticholinergic medication Patients immune system disease .
